intro: Moenchia campestris, commonly known as field sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, aiding in water retention. Moenchia campestris is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields.
